com.github.andreptb.fitnesse

Class SeleniumFixture

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.andreptb.fitnesse.SeleniumFixture

  • public class SeleniumFixture
extends Object
    Slim fixture to execute Selenium commands, see README.md for more information.

      • startBrowser

        public boolean startBrowser(String browser)
                     throws ReflectiveOperationException,
                            MalformedURLException

        | start browser | browser |

        Registers the DRIVER to further execute selenium commands
        Parameters:
        browser - The browser to be used
        Returns:
        result Boolean result indication of assertion/operation
        Throws:
        MalformedURLException - if the remote driver has a malformed URL
        ReflectiveOperationException - if remote driver class cannot be instantiated
        See Also:
        startBrowserWith(String, String)

      • startBrowserWith

        public boolean startBrowserWith(String browser,
                                String capabilities)
                         throws ReflectiveOperationException,
                                MalformedURLException

        | start browser | browser | with | capabilities |

        Registers the DRIVER to further execute selenium commands. Capabilities should be informed in the following format:

        name='some test' platform='LINUX' version='xx'

        This format was used instead of regular json format since FitNesse uses brackets for variables. Quotes between values must be used
        Parameters:
        browser - The browser to be used
        capabilities - Usually used to configure remote driver, but some local driver also uses. For example: name='some test' platform='LINUX' version='xx'
        Returns:
        result Boolean result indication of assertion/operation
        Throws:
        MalformedURLException - if the remote driver has a malformed URL
        ReflectiveOperationException - if remote driver class cannot be instantiated
        See Also:
        FixtureWebDriverProvider.createDriver(String, String)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the current page title

        Selects a popup window using a window locator; once a popup window has been selected, all commands go to that window. Currently supports window search by nameOrHandle, title and current url
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        result Boolean result indication of assertion/operation

      • type

        public boolean type(String value)

        | type | value |

        Sets the value of the current focused input field, as though you typed it in. Can also be used to set the value of combo boxes, check boxes, etc. In these cases, value should be the value of the option selected, not the visible text.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to typeIn
        Returns:
        result Boolean result indication of assertion/operation

      • typeIn

        public boolean typeIn(String value,
                      String locator)

        | type | value | in | locator |

        Sets the value of an input field, as though you typed it in. Can also be used to set the value of combo boxes, check boxes, etc. In these cases, value should be the value of the option selected, not the visible text.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to typeIn
        locator - an element locator
        Returns:
        result Boolean result indication of assertion/operation

      • sendKeys

        public boolean sendKeys(String value)

        | send keys | value |

        Simulates keystroke events on the current focused element, as though you typed the value key-by-key. This simulates a real user typing every character in the specified string; it is also bound by the limitations of a real user, like not being able to type into a invisible or read only elements. This is useful for dynamic UI widgets (like auto-completing combo boxes) that require explicit key events. Unlike the simple "type" command, which forces the specified value into the page directly, this command will not replace the existing content. If you want to replace the existing contents, you need to use the simple "type" command to set the value of the field to empty string to clear the field and then the "sendKeys" command to send the keystroke for what you want to type.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to typeIn
        Returns:
        result Boolean result indication of assertion/operation

      • sendKeysIn

        public boolean sendKeysIn(String value,
                          String locator)

        | send keys | value | in | locator |

        Simulates keystroke events on the specified element, as though you typed the value key-by-key. This simulates a real user typing every character in the specified string; it is also bound by the limitations of a real user, like not being able to type into a invisible or read only elements. This is useful for dynamic UI widgets (like auto-completing combo boxes) that require explicit key events. Unlike the simple "type" command, which forces the specified value into the page directly, this command will not replace the existing content. If you want to replace the existing contents, you need to use the simple "type" command to set the value of the field to empty string to clear the field and then the "sendKeys" command to send the keystroke for what you want to type.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to typeIn
        locator - an element locator
        Returns:
        result Boolean result indication of assertion/operation

      • click

        public boolean click(String locator)

        | click | locator |

        Clicks on a link, button, checkbox or radio button. If the click action causes a new page to load (like a link usually does), call waitForPageToLoad.
        Parameters:
        locator - an element locator
        Returns:
        result Boolean result indication of assertion/operation

      • select

        public boolean select(String optionLocator)

        | select | optionLocator |

        Select an option from the currently focused drop-down using an option locator. Option locators provide different ways of specifying options of an HTML Select element (e.g. for selecting a specific option, or for asserting that the selected option satisfies a specification). There are several forms of Select Option Locator.
        • label=labelPattern: matches options based on their labels, i.e. the visible text. (This is the default.)
        • value=valuePattern: matches options based on their values.
        • index=index: matches an option based on its index (offset from zero).
        Parameters:
        optionLocator - option locator to be used for select action
        Returns:
        result Boolean result indication of assertion/operation

      • selectIn

        public boolean selectIn(String optionLocator,
                        String locator)

        | select | optionLocator | in | locator |

        Select an option from a drop-down using an option locator. Option locators provide different ways of specifying options of an HTML Select element (e.g. for selecting a specific option, or for asserting that the selected option satisfies a specification). There are several forms of Select Option Locator.
        • label=labelPattern: matches options based on their labels, i.e. the visible text. (This is the default.)
        • value=valuePattern: matches options based on their values.
        • index=index: matches an option based on its index (offset from zero).
        Parameters:
        optionLocator - option locator to be used for select action
        locator - an element locator
        Returns:
        result Boolean result indication of assertion/operation

      • selected

        public String selected(String optionType)

        | check | selected | optionType |

        Gets option data for selected option for the currently focused select element. Can return three types of information depending of optionType:
        • label: Gets option label (visible text) for selected option in the specified select element.
        • value: Gets option value (value attribute) for selected option in the specified select element.
        • index: Gets option index (option number, starting at 0) for selected option in the specified select element.
        Parameters:
        optionType - can be label, value or index
        Returns:
        result Boolean result indication of assertion/operation

      • selectedIn

        public String selectedIn(String optionType,
                         String locator)

        | check | selected | optionType | in | locator |

        Gets option data for selected option in the specified select element. Can return three types of information depending of optionType:
        • label: Gets option label (visible text) for selected option in the specified select element.
        • value: Gets option value (value attribute) for selected option in the specified select element.
        • index: Gets option index (option number, starting at 0) for selected option in the specified select element.
        Parameters:
        optionType - can be label, value or index
        locator - an element locator
        Returns:
        result Boolean result indication of assertion/operation

      • value

        public String value(String locator)

        | check | value | locator | expectedValue |

        Gets the (whitespace-trimmed) value of an input field (or anything else with a value parameter). For checkbox/radio elements, the value will be "on" or "off" depending on whether the element is checked or not.
        Parameters:
        locator - an element locator
        Returns:
        value associated with the locator

      • attribute

        public String attribute(String attributeLocator)

        | check | value | attributeLocator | expectedValue |

        Gets the value of an element attribute. The value of the attribute may differ across browsers (this is the case for the "style" attribute, for example).
        Parameters:
        attributeLocator - an element locator followed by an @ sign and then the name of the attribute, e.g. "foo@bar"
        Returns:
        attributeValue the value of the specified attribute
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if locator do not contain an attribute part such as "id=<id>@<attributeName>"

      • text

        public String text(String locator)

        | check | text | locator | expectedValue |

        Gets the text of an element. This works for any element that contains text. This command uses either the textContent (Mozilla-like browsers) or the innerText (IE-like browsers) of the element, which is the rendered text shown to the user.
        Parameters:
        locator - an element locator
        Returns:
        text associated with the locator

      • screenshot

        public String screenshot()
                  throws IOException

        | show | screenshot |

        Takes screenshot from current browser state and returns to be previewed in test result page.
        Returns:
        screenshot saved file absolute path
        Throws:
        IOException - if something goes wrong while manipulating screenshot file

      • present

        public boolean present(String locator)

        | ensure | present | locator |

        Verifies that the specified element is somewhere on the page. There's a little difference from SeleniumIDE version, this method also supports attributes, if the selector is something like "id=<id>@<attributeName>", this method will return true if the attribute exists on the element with any value.
        Parameters:
        locator - an element locator
        Returns:
        result Boolean result indication of assertion/operation

      • notPresent

        public boolean notPresent(String locator)

        | ensure | not present | locator |

        Verifies that the specified element is not somewhere on the page. There's a little difference from SeleniumIDE version, this method also supports attributes, if the selector is something like "id=<id>@<attributeName>", this method will return true if the attribute don't exists on the element with any value.
        Parameters:
        locator - an element locator
        Returns:
        result Boolean result indication of assertion/operation
